body_html:
My personal view: I always perfer to use bazel than cmake for building tensorflow on Windows, because it can do incremental build very well. At this time, bazel on Windows works well except it can't build the custom ops under tf.contrib, thus all stuffs under tf.contrib are missing. We won't get it until bazelbuild/bazel#1920 is fixed. I wish bazel team could put more resources on this issue. After that, we can deprecate cmake and unify the build systems, reduce the extra maintain cost. The more build systems we have, the harder to add a new file in tensorflow.

@meteorcloudy
